byline.contributor: Kay Nolan reported from Milwaukee, and Julie Bosman from Chicago.
byline.original: By KAY NOLAN and JULIE BOSMAN

abstract: Milwaukee Police Dept, along with Wisconsin's Natural Resources Dept and local wildlife officials, continues to search for large 'catlike animal' that has been spotted by many residents and at least one police officer; there is speculation about whether creature is a young African lion, a mountain lion or a cougar, but it has certainly unsettled city.
lead_paragraph: Milwaukee officials are still not sure exactly what kind of animal has been spotted for the last week. It could be a lion; it could be a cougar. Whatever it is, it has captivated the city.

headline.main: A Creature on the Loose Puts Milwaukee Residents on Edge
headline.print_headline: Reports of a Creature on the Loose Put Milwaukee on Edge

snippet: Milwaukee officials are still not sure exactly what kind of animal has been spotted for the last week. It could be a lion; it could be a cougar. Whatever it is, it has captivated the city.
